channel.title: I'd like your first impression
channel.description:
I'm doing a small survey, and since this forum has visitors from many countries and places, I thought it would be ideal to post it here.
If you are willing, [b]I would be curious to know your first impressions about the people in the images below.[/b] I don't need any long explanations or anything, but would just like to know what you would initially think of you saw either of them walking down the street or something.
[table][tr][td][IMG]http://img525.imageshack.us/img525/1994/sikhman02jt4.jpg[/img][/td][td][IMG]http://img388.imageshack.us/img388/4430/dsc04172smallvh4.jpg[/img][/td][/tr][/table]
With credits to shunya.net and gakhal.com for the photos.
Thanks for your help ;)

@system wrote:

Well I believe both guys are from India?Or the left one could be from Sri Lanka?

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:64, topic:121516”]The people who are posting “Ahhh terrorist run!!!” is inappropriate and racist. It is their culture and they deserve just as much respect as you all do.

Think of if that was you, and you knew people were talking about how you looked and dressed. I am certain that there are Muslims that do join these forums, what do you think they would say if you said something rude? If you guessed them feeling bad and flaming you possibly, you are correct.

Therefore, I will remind you all to think before you speak. Before you post, always ask yourself, is this inappropriate and possibly offensive? If the answer is yes, then you should not post it.[/quote]
I was offended by your post because I believe in freedom of speech. I think it is stupid to not say your opinion (one must of course justify it well) because you feel that it might offend someone. However, just shouting random things like “NUKE SWEDEN!” is obviously not appropriate. In my opinion we have to able to openly discuss anything. This includes drugs, the law, terrorism … you name it.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

The people who are posting “Ahhh terrorist run!!!” is inappropriate and racist. It is their culture and they deserve just as much respect as you all do.

Think of if that was you, and you knew people were talking about how you looked and dressed. I am certain that there are Muslims that do join these forums, what do you think they would say if you said something rude? If you guessed them feeling bad and flaming you possibly, you are correct.

Therefore, I will remind you all to think before you speak. Before you post, always ask yourself, is this inappropriate and possibly offensive? If the answer is yes, then you should not post it.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Oh, absolutely, I was just talking to Fr33sc4p3 about this actually. Even during WWII, the Japanese living in America were persecuted and were placed into camps. But one would imagine that with such widespread media and news access, it might have been possible to get people to abandon their stereotypes. But they do seem to make it worse. I mean, from this thread alone it is clear that people still maintain stereotypical beliefs.

But lothy, for stating yourself that its all media induced, you don’t seem to have much faith in your own words judging on your previous post…I mean, if the fear has been unfairly and unnecessarily spread, why do you feel it?

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:60, topic:121516”][quote author=akisboy32 link=topic=171122.msg1590009#msg1590009 date=1184267656]
Well You are again saying you act towards “Muslims” … why only “muslims”?
not other religions? am just wondering?..
[/quote]
Because Muslims have been automatically labeled as terrorists after 9/11, of course. This was another reason for posting this thread…its obvious that people still believe Sikhs to be Muslims. We have the same kinds of issues that you guys have…not to mention that we stand out a tad more as well.[/quote]
With regards to that, they aren’t the first group to be labeled as bad. They certainly won’t be the last either.

If you are interested in history, then you will be aware of what happened with communism. Everyone hated the Russians and the Chinese, much like a lot of people hate muslims now. That hate is usually an outward manifestation of fear felt by a person (much like you will see a person’s eyes move to the right when they try to recall something, or upwards when they are thinking). That fear, for most people, is indeed media induced.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

To be honest lothy, say if it was the Australians instead of the Muslims?
Say it was a way of culture in australia for some people, but not for the whole of australia, i mean just like in iraq, Pakistan and other surrounding country’s a very small amount believe in the culture of doing what the suicide bombers do.

But yeah imagine it was the Australians doing that, but you are completely innocent and don’t follow this culture of the suicide bombers, but as you are Australian you get stereotyped for being a suicide bomber, you would hate that.

But if you want to think that way about Muslims/other religions then do so, but keep it to yourself because honestly i imagine a huge majority of Muslims are going through a whole lot of crap other this because of the real offenders.

I know here in england, a shop near me run by a muslim couple constantly got abuse thrown at them, things like “go back to your own country terrorists” things like that, eventually the shop (they also lived above the shop) got petrol bombed.

So like i said, you wouldn’t like it if you was being labeled as something because of something, say another Australian done.

(Sorry for my bad wording i was typing fast and not thinking much about it lol)

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“akisboy32, post:1, topic:122381”]Yup i know the muslim religion was After all those religions…
And when you say where you heard all that rubbish? its offensive to me because A “shieck” which is the same as “pop” if i spelled it right in the christian religion …
And i dont think he says “Rubbish” stuff.
“Why do Sikhs wear turbans?” did not say why do they wear them i said when they can take it off
and if this thread will be all racism and will make bigger problem then…AM OUT…

What about People getting impression if someone says “Muslim” then you think of terrorism?
and Bob am sorry if that was offensive to you…I really say it again i respect any religion .[/quote]

Well then, as I said in my other post, the turban is a part of our dress. We wear it all the time in public (whether we wear the full turban or a “mini” one), and only really keep it off at home and when sleeping. Sikhism teaches respect of all religions - we are taught of the equality of all people regardless of religion, race, sex, etc…

Any kind of violence between Sikhs and Muslims (which does exist in places like London, I believe) reflects the people, not the religion. Just like you cannot attribute the actions of terrorists such as Al-Quaeda to the teachings of Islam.

Again, I don’t know where you’re getting that about Sikhs taking off their turbans only when they kill a Muslim. And again, I invite you to find me some information about it. But I have told you what I know…and I am quite confident that what I know is what Sikhism actually teaches. I took offense to that one statement of yours, but if I can correct your belief I will be more than appeased.

[quote=“akisboy32, post:1, topic:122383”]Well You are again saying you act towards “Muslims” … why only “muslims”?
not other religions? am just wondering?..[/quote]
Because Muslims have been automatically labeled as terrorists after 9/11, of course. This was another reason for posting this thread…its obvious that people still believe Sikhs to be Muslims. We have the same kinds of issues that you guys have…not to mention that we stand out a tad more as well.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

There are a lot of muslims in the world. And most aren’t bad. But the problem is that you don’t know which ones are bad.

Let’s presume you’re shopping for an Xbox 360 (many 360s have problems). For one, you might be turned off buying one completely, because if something is wrong with it then you’ll have to go through the hassle of returning it and getting a replacement.
But let’s say you did go to buy one. You pick one up, and go to the checkout. You don’t know whether it’s good or not unless you open the box and test it.

I act the same way towards muslims at times (and people that look like muslims). At the end of the day, I’m the sort of person that would rather be alive, instead of taking the risk and trusting someone who is potentially a ‘bad product’.

As for it being a ‘racist’ thing to do… Well, try telling that to the families of the victims of the Bali bombings, or the bombings in England.

EDIT: Fixed a typo.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Ahhh, well i guess i was wrong on that one :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“akisboy32, post:1, topic:122373”]i never said they desire to kill a muslim i said that they will not take the thing off theire head’s “untill” they kill a muslim if you do not believe what am saying search in google or ask one of them.
If anyone of that religion thinks that is offensive to them i am sorry i will take all those posts off.[/quote]

Before I say anything else at all to you, I would like you to find any kind of mention of that on the internet…anywhere. Making such a comment, in my view, requires some kind of basis.

There’s no need to remove your posts, but I still do find it offensive for it is entirely untrue, primarily because I am Sikh. I have grown up as a Sikh, learning the teachings, and I have never heard of such a thing. The turban and uncut hair maintain our identity. Seriously, 99% of the people in the US who keep that appearance are Sikh and not Muslim. The turban was introduced for two reasons: it keeps our hair tidy and clean, and it disregards the cast system that existed in India during Sikhism’s founding. Besides that, it is obvious to say that wearing a turban makes you stand out. Thus, it is a constant reminder to abide by the teachings of Sikhi and to follow the rules of society, for one’s actions represent not only yourself but the entire Sikh community.

Honestly, in the US where there are such few Sikhs to begin with, the impression you leave on people is quite important for that determines how they will view all other Sikhs in the future. For that reason alone, I find that extremely offensive. And I invite you to show me evidence contrary to what I have said, and to back up your claim.

Thank you for your support, Fr33sc4p3, and thank you for that link. But I must correct you in one sense: Sikhism is a relatively new religion, founded in 1463 (if i remember correctly). Our identify (including the turban) was given to us on April 13th, 1699. Islam began in the 7th century, I believe, so it is far older. However, whereas a turban is a part of a Sikh’s dress, turbans are worn by an extremely small percentage of Muslims, and is primarily used to indicate wealth, power, or class.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

BobDole81, its obvious what the media has done to the world, given millions of people a stereotypical opinion on each religion.

It gets me so mad at how these people look at other religions and think “omg hes a jew he must be rich and hate palastinions”

or the “ahh, a foriegn man with a bag on run!”

I thought only little children thought that?[quote=“akisboy32, post:1, topic:122373”]i never said they desire to kill a muslim i said that they will not take the thing off theire head’s “untill” they kill a muslim if you do not believe what am saying search in google or ask one of them.
If anyone of that religion thinks that is offensive to them i am sorry i will take all those posts off.[/quote]

Were have you heard that rubbish?
Sikhs have been around much longer than Muslims considering the Muslim religion is one of the newest, they had the turban before the Muslim religion even existed.

Why do Sikhs wear turbans?

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“akisboy32, post:1, topic:122371”][quote author=BobDole81 link=topic=171122.msg1589946#msg1589946 date=1184265506]

PLease when you say “muslims” do not add them to your terrorist’s List because A small number of muslims are terrorist …From every country there must be some Terrorist and he must not be muslim.
Because that will be an offencive thing to me and thanks.
i just want to say about the Two indians above there that they are from the sieck religion and they are minding them selves …although and i am saying this because am sure of they WIll never take the thing off they’re head untill they kill a MUSLIM . thanks =)

Completely understandable that you would find such generalizations offensive…I mean out of 1.2 billion Muslims in the world, its amazingly closed-minded to assume that all Muslims are terrorists.

But I have to ask you, what in the world do you mean by: “i just want to say about the Two indians above there that they are from the sieck religion and they are minding them selves …although and i am saying this because am sure of they WIll never take the thing off they’re head untill they kill a MUSLIM.”

If I interpret it correctly, I find that one comment hugely offensive…
[/quote]
am sorry if it was offensive to any one here but i just wanted to tell you that because it’s a “fact” and if you ask them they will say what i have just said and if it was an offensive then all religions are offensive to others?? am just telling what they really say and i Respect they religion ot any other religions.[/quote]

You’re saying that if you speak to any Sikh, what they will tell you is that their desire is to kill a Muslim? Can you please explain that you mean, and what kind of ground you have to make such a statement? I don’t mean to be attacking you at all, I just wish to know…

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like your first impression
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:50, topic:121516”][quote author=BobDole81 link=topic=171122.msg1589781#msg1589781 date=1184260602]
Well thank you for your responses so far…granted, some of them were not exactly what I was looking for but it helps nonetheless I will see if I can keep this topic going just a tad longer and ask you all:

[b]If you had to guess, what would you say the nationalities (ie. country of origin) are of these two men?[/b}

Also, some of you seem to be mixing up your rights and lefts so lets go for white beard/black beard this time
[/quote]
I’d say that the guy with the black beard is from either Iraq or Israel. The white bearded guy is probably from a similar region.[/quote]

And i thought you was smart

i just want to say about the Two indians above there that they are from the sieck religion and they are minding them selves …although and i am saying this because am sure of they WIll never take the thing off they’re head untill they kill a MUSLIM . thanks =)[/quote]

But I have to ask you, what in the world do you mean by: “i just want to say about the Two indians above there that they are from the sieck religion and they are minding them selves …although and i am saying this because am sure of they WIll never take the thing off they’re head untill they kill a MUSLIM.”
